title: How to Make a Balloon Giraffe

steps.headline: Inflate the balloon.
steps.description: Leave about two to three inches/5-7.5cm un-inflated at the end before you tie-off. A hand pump works best for this - not only is it more sanitary, but it is also difficult to inflate long balloons by mouth.

steps.headline: Make the nose.
steps.description: Starting at the knot, take a section about three inches/7.5cm from the top and twist two to three times. Hold the section to keep it from unraveling.

steps.headline: Shape the ears.
steps.description: Twist off 2 two-inch sections. Keep holding all of the sections.

steps.headline: Twist the ears together.
steps.description: Fold between the ears so the nose and first ear section are along the length of the balloon. The ends of the ears should line up. While holding the nose and body in one hand, twist the ears with the other hand. Now you should have a nose, ears, and a long body.

steps.headline: Make the neck.
steps.description: The length of the neck should be about nine inches/23cm - long enough to make it clear that this is a giraffe! Twist off the neck section and hold it (like in Step 2).

steps.headline: Twist off 2 leg sections.
steps.description: These are usually about 3-4 inches/7.5-10cm. Continue to hold all of the sections.

steps.headline: Twist the legs together.
steps.description: Using the same method as you did in Step 4, fold between the leg sections and twist them together.

steps.headline: Make the body.
steps.description: Take enough balloon to create the body (but keep in mind that you'll need 6-8 inches/15-20cm for the hind legs!) and twist off the section.

steps.headline: Make the hind legs.
steps.description: Twist off 2 three-four inch sections for the legs. Fold and twist using the method from Step 4; the remaining balloon becomes the tail. Done! You have a giraffe!
